details.purpose: Specifies the description of the medication as part of an INSTRUCTION or ACTION recording taken with regard to medication. This will usually be in response to a medication order or prescription, but may be self administered or supplied by a pharmacy.
details.use: For use with INSTRUCTION.medication and ACTION.medication to describe the medication

items.items: The description of a medication for recording as part of an ACTION or INSTRUCTION
The name of the intervention - which may be coded
Detailed instructions about how to administer this medication
The number of dose units to be taken at any time
The dose unit that is given for this type of medication
The time over which an individual dose is to be administered
Included and set to true if this medication is to be used continuously or repeatedly over a significant period of time.
Indications including related problems and diagnoses, abnormal test results etc
The generic name of the drug which is an alternative name to the name of medication
The maximum number of dose units to be taken in a particular time
The dose per kg of body weight
The minimum safe interval between doses
The maximum safe interval between doses
Information relating to the administration of the medication order
The date and time (if required) the medication is/was first administered
The site of administration e.g. outer thigh if intramuscular, via PEG if patient is nil orally
The total quantity to be dispensed
The number of times this quantity of medication may be dispensed before a further prescription is required
The name of the product dispensed
True if an alternative brand may be substituted when dispensing
Dispenser counselled the patient with regard to the Consumer Medicines Information
True if the supply of the medication has been deferred
Information relating to the reason for deferred supply
The date and time (if required) the medication is to be administered for the last time
The dose to be administered at one time
Dose as number (or fraction) of the dose units
The quantity (or range) to be administered as a single dose
On admission to hospital, medication is from subject's own supply.
Dose, frequency, route & instruction as narrative.
any term that 'is a' Dose unit for this form
A set of terms that describes the dose units for medication - e.g. tablet, puff, ampule etc - which allow the dose to be expressed as a number.
Any term that 'is_a' route of administration
The route by which the medication is administered
